title: Ka-wayawayama: Aeroplane Dance
creator_credit: Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham, Christina Pozzan and Film Australia
brief_description: Records the story of “Ka-wayawayama” or “Aeroplane Dance” of the Yanuwa people of the Borroloola area in the Northern Territory. The dance was created after an American “Liberator” bomber crashed in the area in 1942, after a mission in the South-west Pacific. Re-creates the plight of the flight crew in their trek across inhospitable terrain across the Gulf of Carpentaria and the search for the lost crew.
creator_credit_for_label: Jan Wositzky, Trevor Graham, Christina Pozzan and Film Australia
